Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1924,1201.762. Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior (Williams 1983, 169). Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 168, no. 153)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 728, no. 880)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1766) (phase 2)
